segments.text: I see the woman is so focused on that plate, she doesn't even see the water everywhere, it's like she's in her own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is being so sneaky, trying to get those cookies without her noticing, he's really stretching for them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe how reckless he's being, standing on that wobbly stool like that, he's going to fall!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her share, not a care in the world, she's so trusting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they've done this before, taken cookies when they're not supposed to, they seem so practiced.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out of the sink, and she's standing right in the middle of it, drying that plate like nothing's wrong, it's almost funny.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like someone should really do something about all this, but who? Maybe me?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is all so surprising to watch, like a train wreck in slow motion, I can't look away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she snaps out of it soon, before someone gets hurt, but I'm not holding my breath.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but feel a bit happy seeing the kids working together like that, even if it's not the best behavior.
segments.speaker: PAR
